citeinfo.title: Mississippi River Critical Area Boundary and Districts

pubinfo.publish: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) - Division of Waters

descript.abstract: The shapefile shows the distribution and boundaries of the Mississippi River Critical Area, including its four landuse districts.
descript.purpose: The dataset was developed as an aid in landuse planning and zoning activities associated with the Mississippi River Critical Area. The four distinct districts established for the Critical Area determine many landuse criteria.
descript.supplinf: The area encompasses 54,000 acres along a 72-mile stretch of the Mississippi River in the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area and includes parts of Anoka, Hennepin, Dakota, Ramsey, and Washington counties.

timeperd.current: The boundaries and districts were established by Executive Order in 1976 and have remained static.

theme.themekey: Mississippi River Critical Area, Critical Area Districts, landuse, planning, zoning

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scales greater than 24,000.

attracc.attraccr: Source table BDRY_MRCTRPY2.DBF: Not specifically assessed.

dataqual.logic: Polygon and arc-node topology exists in source data

procstep.procdesc: Attribute Lineage for source table BDRY_MRCTRPY2.DBF: Derived from National Park Service NPS Midwest Field Area data set.
